column4: can someone knows what is wrong, i have cnet pro200 network card but no internet, 8.04 network manager shows it is ok
can someone knows what is wrong, i have cnet pro200 network card but no internet, 8.04 network manager shows it is ok - it should be automatically on
5 years old card
is it detect at all?
like does lspci show it?
how to test it
ls -lh home/daniel/.rubyripper/freedb.yaml
no such file or directory, is there easyer way
sorry, ifconfig, if you type that does it show an interface eth0
do you use dhcp?
i just wanted to know if you get an ip from your router or need to setup the networking properties by hand
if you have dhcp try this: sudo dhclient eth0     and see if you have an ip and the correct gateway set and can access the internets then
that mostlikely means there is no dhcp server or the cable is not properly configured
i mean the cable isnt luged in right or something
try dmesg and see of theres something about the interface eth0
there is something wrong with the link then, maybe try another cable/port on the router
and what driver does it use? maybe thats some bug in the driver
look what lspci shows for the lan card
whats the full name? and what drivers are loaded for that?
what driver does it use? maybe try dmesg|grep eth0    there might be some message from the driver
i guess its just a card/chipset that isnt well supported, make sure the tulip driver is not loaded and that it uses dmfe as the driver, if that doesnt work get some other card
